translated: The Assortment of Pots🔽The Jātaka of the Disenchanted Body
“Having been struck by a certain illness,
I am greatly afflicted by disease and suffering;
Like a flower on the ground in the sun.

analyzed: jañña rūpam a passato  dhiratthumam āturam pūtikāya
translated: Not seeing the form of the wise.🔽The hollow man, the sick, the decaying body,
The disgusting, impure, subject to illness;
Wherein people are attached and infatuated,
They lose the path to a good rebirth.”
The Jātaka of the Disenchanted Body, the third.
